headline.main: Dining Out; ITALIAN CUISINE AND A RIVER VIEW

docs.lead_paragraph: STAMFORD IF restaurant ratings were based on service, Rugantino's, an Italian restaurant on the Post Road between Stamford and Darien, would be at the head of the class. The service, based on three recent visits (two lunches and one dinner) was consistently professional, accommodating and friendly. Unfortunately, consistency is a word that cannot be properly applied to the cuisine. The food soared at dinner from a one-star (good) to an occasional two-star (very good), then plummeted at one lunch in which all the entrees were nearly inedible. Over all, we would have to categorize the culinary performance as fair. The potential is there, but the erratic performance suggests inadequate supervision in the kitchen, especially at lunchtime.

headline.main: De Gustibus Cuisine Mystery Solved: The Etymology of Ramp

docs.lead_paragraph: I have observed over the years that there is more interest in members of the onion family than in any other form of vegetables or herbs. Perhaps it is because onion-related ingredients garlic, chives, scallions and so on are so indispensable in a vast majority of American kitchens.

headline.main: Food News; Facts and Fantasy on Haute Cuisine

headline.main: Dining Out; Bolognese Cuisine in a Croton Falls Setting

docs.abstract: M H Reed reviews Mona's Trattoria, Italian restaurant in Croton Falls, NY (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: MEMORIES of this restaurant's halcyon days, when Mona and John Martelli first brought their native Bolognese cuisine to Croton Falls from City Island, keep us coming back, hoping that the past has been recaptured. Our visits always begin with anticipation: such lovely dining rooms must be the setting for a glorious meal. Unfortunately, the effort expended on the appointments is not reflected in the care and feeding of guests. Diners following our general recommendation -- a first course, an entree of pasta and perhaps a dessert -- will most likely have a satisfying meal and wonder at the rating. But Mona's kitchen produces wonderful dishes and unacceptable ones, with little in between.
